meanings.definition: To go back or move backward
meanings.sent1: The car was retroceding slowly down the hill.
meanings.sent2: She was retroceding to the previous page in the book.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept retroceding playfully when chased by the dog.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were retroceding to happier times.
meanings.sent5: The river was retroceding, revealing hidden treasures along its banks.

meanings.definition: To cede or surrender something previously granted
meanings.sent1: The country was retroceding control of the territory to its neighbor.
meanings.sent2: He was retroceding ownership of the land to the original owner.
meanings.sent3: The child was retroceding his toy to his sibling after playing with it.
meanings.sent4: She felt like retroceding her decision after seeing the consequences.
meanings.sent5: The company was retroceding its profits to support a charitable cause.

meanings.definition: To retreat or withdraw from a position
meanings.sent1: The soldiers were retroceding from the battlefield under heavy fire.
meanings.sent2: The team was retroceding to regroup and come up with a new strategy.
meanings.sent3: The students were retroceding from the debate after realizing they were wrong.
meanings.sent4: She was retroceding from her argument to avoid further conflict.
meanings.sent5: The company was retroceding from the market due to tough competition.
